vmassol - (12:56): abusenius: ping. I don't understand one of your tests  
abusenius - (12:56): pong  
abusenius - (12:56): which one?  
vmassol - (12:56): inLanguageTest.java, in checkLanguageTagsArePresent  
vmassol - (12:56): you have an assertion:  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 12:56  
vmassol - (12:56):         String content = getDriver().getPageSource();  
vmassol - (12:56):         Assert.assertTrue(content.contains("language=" + language));  
vmassol - (12:56): I'm not sure what this is testing  
abusenius - (12:56): let me look  
vmassol - (12:56): there are lots of places in the content where there's language= in url  
vmassol - (12:56): urls  
vmassol - (12:57): btw I'm fixing your test  
vmassol - (12:57): it wasn't using existing apis  
vmassol - (12:57): (we have an api for getting metadata)  
abusenius - (13:04): hm, I guess this is a very unprecise way to assure that language=something was set/changed  
abusenius - (13:06): I guess I was too lazy to check all the places exactly  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 13:08  
jvdrean left #xwiki at 13:08  
lucaa left at 13:08 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 13:08  
abusenius - (13:09): ah, I think I remember, this method was also used to test language escaping  
abusenius - (13:10): and since the generated is "beautified", wrong html caused some tests to pass  
abusenius - (13:11): and this was probably a fix for it  
abusenius - (13:11): (vmassol)  
abusenius - (13:13): I should have commented that line

vmassol - (14:50): abusenius: I'm still unsure what it's testing. Could you comment it more precisely? (ie explain what part of the HTML is tested)  
abusenius - (15:34): vmassol: it is testing whether there is at least one link with language parameter set in the source code, when multilanguage mode is off, there are no such links  
abusenius - (15:36): it is a very approximate assertion, just remove it if you don't like it

florinciu joined #xwiki at 16:35  
jbrBridge - (17:21): [hazardj] Hi everybody.  I'm the newest newbie.  At the moment, I'm feeling my way around.  Could you tell me where I can find answers to questions like -- how do I make a section in a page that can be separately edited? -- something that in MediaWiki would be ==Section Name== and have an edit me button on the right of the title?  Thanks.  Sorry if posting in the wrong place.  :)  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 17:35  
vmassol left at 17:51 (Ping timeout: 255 seconds  
venkatesh left at 17:53 (Ping timeout: 250 seconds  
cjdelisle - (18:30): !who  
jbrBridge - (18:30): \* members: hazardj  
florinciu left at 18:30 (Ping timeout: 272 seconds  
cjdelisle - (18:31): hazardj: try looking up XWikiSyntax. I don't have a web browser on this computer.  
cjdelisle - (18:32): !search XWikiSyntax  
cjdelisle - (18:32): ^^ that's it.  
jbrBridge - (19:42): [hazardj] Thanks.  I didn't find what I was looking for there.  Perhaps what I am looking for is considered to be a macro rather than markup.  (For instance, I notice that "include" is a macro.)     {{mediawiki}}==Heading=={{/mediawiki}} doesn't do the job.  Nor does:  
jbrBridge - (19:42): [hazardj] {{script language="mediawiki"}}  
jbrBridge - (19:42): [hazardj] ==Heading==  
jbrBridge - (19:42): [hazardj] {{/script}}  
sdumitriu - (19:49): hazardj: Why don't you just try  
sdumitriu - (19:49): == Heading ==  
sdumitriu - (19:50): It should make an editable section  
sdumitriu - (19:51): Note that the first title isn't always editable, since in the absence of a specific document title, the first heading is extracted as the document title  
rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 20:48

jbrBridge - (21:30): [hazardj] Thanks, you  
jbrBridge - (21:31): [hazardj] 're right!  I thought I tried it before on a different installation, but .. wow, great!  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 21:32  
vmassol - (22:28): hmmm can anyone confirm that editing a section in wysiwyg doesn't work when in syntax 1.0?  
vmassol - (22:29): (we have a test for it but when I execute it manually I don't see a link to click for section editing when using tinymce)  
vmassol - (22:29): (so I don't understand how the test can pass....)  
cjdelisle - (22:37): Starting tomcat now.  
cjdelisle - (22:44): Cannot confirm. I made a page with "1 section 1<\n>text<\n>1 section 2<\n>text<\n>1 section 3<\n>text" then I viewed and clicked the section edit marker for section 2, I was shown only section 2 and was able to edit it.  
vmassol - (22:45): hmm yes  
vmassol - (22:45): my bad  
vmassol - (22:45): I was looking for the section edit links inside the wysiwyg editor  
sdumitriu - (23:07): vmassol: Are you looking at the failing section edit tests?  
vmassol - (23:07): sdumitriu: I was porting it to ui-tests indeed  
vmassol - (23:07): but going to bed now  
sdumitriu - (23:17): Hm, this looks bad: http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests-2.5/com.xpn.xwiki.products$xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/19/testReport/com.xpn.xwiki.it.selenium/StandardFeaturesTest/testNestedCustomInlineStyles/  
sdumitriu - (23:17): Styles aren't correctly merged anymore  
vmassol left at 23:19 (Quit: Leaving.  
cjdelisle - (23:21): argh. Start debugging XWIKI-5640 and it vanishes.  
cjdelisle - (23:23): Phantom bugs from my sound card, now phantom bugs here. Happy Halloween.
